poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of Westminster"

Labour's rusted sword, Starmer, so rife,
Claims opponent "Doesn't get life."
Through Westminster's grating,
Both lefty and right - baiting,
In this spectacle of strident strife.
Yet, in the heartland, the farmer's wife,
Tills the soil, cuts the chaff with a knife,
Unheard amidst the debating,
In the shadow of Westminster.
From the quiet, cogent life,
Distant seems this political strife,
Where leaders claim to be nation's life,
Yet appear just jesters in satirical skits.
In the shadow of Westminster.
